title: Subtle continuous hero dog image animation with reduced-motion support

requirements.summary: Add a subtle continuous floating/bobbing + slight rotation animation to the existing hero dog image without changing its src or layout styling.
acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page, the hero image at /assets/generated/icp-meme-doge-hero.dim_1600x900.png animates continuously with subtle motion (not distracting).
The hero image remains responsive (keeps its current sizing, rounded corners, and shadow styling) and does not overlap or shift other sections unexpectedly.
The image src path remains exactly /assets/generated/icp-meme-doge-hero.dim_1600x900.png.

file_operations.description: Extend Tailwind with a dedicated hero-image keyframes/animation (e.g., gentle translateY + small rotate) tuned for slow, subtle motion that uses transforms only to avoid layout shifts.

Apply the new animation utility to the existing hero while keeping the current src exactly "/assets/generated/icp-meme-doge-hero.dim_1600x900.png" and preserving existing responsive/rounded/shadow classes; prefer motion-safe variants and add transform-related performance hints (e.g., will-change) without affecting layout.

requirements.summary: Respect prefers-reduced-motion by disabling or significantly reducing the hero image motion for users who request reduced motion.
acceptanceCriteria: With prefers-reduced-motion enabled in the browser/OS, the hero image animation is removed or reduced to near-static behavior.
No rapid flashing is introduced; motion remains smooth and slow.

file_operations.description: Ensure the hero image animation is gated by reduced-motion handling (e.g., use motion-safe for the animation and motion-reduce to disable it) so users with prefers-reduced-motion see near-static behavior.

Add a prefers-reduced-motion CSS safeguard that disables (or nearly eliminates) the hero image animation class to ensure reduced motion is respected even if class variants change; keep motion smooth/slow and avoid any flashing behavior.
